title: GW needs to be removed. Lifesteal and other self-healers need nerfs to compensate.
body:
or we can just keep this dance going where other classes/champions get shit on to deal with ADC draintanking.

{{champion:106}} {{champion:2}} {{champion:48}} {{champion:36}} {{champion:420}} {{champion:75}} {{champion:83}} {{champion:5}} {{champion:19}} {{champion:266}} {{champion:84}} all getting shafted instead of dealing with the problem directly

 Why exactly do other champs needs to get destroyed instead of just nerfing Lifesteal items? Why can't we just remove GW that dumpsters entire champions and then nerf the problem children that crop up? Start with a blanket nerf of lifesteal items.

Throw some preemptive nerfs for {{champion:8}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:16}} {{champion:50}} in there

Isn't that a better solution than some mechanic tacked on to random items that leaves entire kits completely cucked? It's getting pretty infuriating that ADCs are destroying entire classes over and over and over again. Lethality items got hijacked by ADCs and the resulting nerfs dumpstered the Assassin class. As a {{champion:62}} main I've had to sit through multiple rounds of nerfs to {{item:3071}} and {{item:3142}} because of this fucking guy {{champion:236}}. They even highjack shit like {{item:3047}} {{item:3053}} and get them nerfed.

Thank god {{item:3074}} /{{item:3748}} are melee only or else they would be gutted too due to some bullshit {{item:3085}} combo. I GUARANTEE it.

This shit is getting out of control. You need to address the problem directly instead of destroying other champs in the crossfire.

It's kind of like how Rammus suddenly became popular after the Marksmen update and then got nerfed. Like... what do you expect to happen when the champions he is specifically designed to counter become meta all over the map?

Can someone explain this bs to me. 
X becomes powerful because Y is meta. We nerf X because X is the only way to deal with Y and then nerf Y _anyways_ because Y was the problem to begin with making the nerf to X plain pointless.
and then Z comes around because X and Y are now both weak, a new meta starts and we get "trickle down" stat checks until riot randomly buffs a champion

Riot nerfs X because it's "clearly too dominantly strong", and then after they remove the only way to deal with Y, and Y absolutely takes over, Riot nerfs Y because it's "clearly too dominantly strong", and then leaves X in the gutter because all decisions they make are final and the best decisions ever. Reverting nerfs would be tantamount to admitting they were wrong, after all.
Ah the riot special.

and then the white knights came along, "oh, but those boots have always been overpowered...just no one noticed until now"

it's true though. they only noticed them because of LCS.

How many times do certain champions become "OP" or "meta" all of a sudden just because of LCS? They don't need to be buffed or anything.

EDIT: examples? No one played J4 before they started playing him in the LCS recently.
Ziggs bot all of a sudden and even played mid.. why? Because of LCS.

Were they buffed? No. Just people are sheep and following others.

Jayce? Same thing. Was literally in the same exact state, barely any buffs. Was really strong even before the lethality meta. Wasn't seen played as much because they stopped picking him in ProPlay.

There's "hidden" OP champs out there that are just waiting for pro players to play them for everyone to call them OP. It's really sad.

It's just sheep realising a champion is strong only after others play it, especially if someone in the LCS did.
This happens with items just as much as with champions. Undeniable.

I've always thought Tabi's were a great item, slightly too strong even.
People only caught on after it was "discovered" in the LCS because.. sheep.

So yeah, call us white knights for stating a fact.

I don't think it was intended, but you said "sole" reason. Cause boots have soles. haha

-ap so you get real pen items
